results.title: Pure steam: The Flying Scotsman in Australia (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Peter Henshaw, Jim Revitt and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: For almost a year the world’s most famous working steam locomotive, The Flying Scotsman 4472, from Britain, thrilled Australian steam enthusiasts from coast to coast. During 1988/89 4472 visited five Australian states and the Northern Territory. Its spectacular parallel runs, double-heading and solo trips have been brilliantly recorded by camera crews from ABC TV, from the air, trackside and on board.
results.title_for_label: Pure steam: The Flying Scotsman in Australia (Captioned)

results.title: Puppet animation
results.creator_credit: David Johnson, Eric Halliday, Mark Sanders, Nancy Wahlquist and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A sequel to “The Animation game” (T/Code 015386) that examines and demonstrates the many possibilities of puppet animation. Produced in a humorous and stylistically appealing manner. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Punk in London
results.brief_description: Originally shot in colour 16mm film, this DVD edition has some of the hallmarks of an old print - scratches, pink tinge in the colour and generally dubious quality. But all of this can be forgiven, as the content of the work is a wonderful documentary of live footage of concerts of UK punk bands given in late 1970s London and Germany. Features bands The Clash, The Adverts, The Jam, The Boomtown Rats, The Electric Chairs and others. Includes interviews, shots of street-wear fashion and crowds, including loving audiences pogo-ing with great delight and alcohol fuelled fervour. This film captures the youth of the day and their quest to make themselves seen and heard, singing “Oh Bondage, Up Yours!” Directed by Wolfgang Buld from the Munich Film School. (Please note a small glitch occurs at 00:09:57 min).

results.title: Girl in danger: The Case of a pre-delinquent girl
results.creator_credit: Robert Anderson and Robert Anderson Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Disordered Mind”.
Psychiatrists Dr. June Cumberland and Dr. S.J. Shamsie interview Susan, a thirteen year old girl on the verge of becoming a delinquent. Susan’s parents are also interviewed. Susan is intelligent and a leader; she is thirteen but looks eighteen, and emotionally most of the time is nearer six. She becomes a problem for her parents, her school and herself: she is apparently rushing toward delinquency. Her behaviour is discussed with police, her teachers and in counselling sessions with Susan and her parents. Susan still has problems after seven months of treatment but she has learned how to handle them with more maturity, and has a better relationship with her parents.

results.title: A Coronary
results.creator_credit: Robert Anderson, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Robert Anderson Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Disordered Mind”.
The case of a successful 34 year old insurance salesman whose inner conflicts trigger a heart attack. The patient talks with Dr. Harold N. Segall, who describes the damage to the heart. The patient is interviewed by psychiatrist Dr. Henry Kravitz and a clear picture of the patient’s emotional background emerges bearing directly on the heart attack.

results.title: Psychoneurotic conditions: obsessive-compulsive neurosis
results.creator_credit: Robert Anderson and Robert Anderson Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Disordered Mind”.
Presents the case-history of a middle-aged man who, despite good education and intellect has been unable to hold a job during the five years prior to the start of treatment for an obsessive-compulsive neurosis. Includes the patient’s feelings about his symptoms and his progress in therapy.

results.title: Afraid of school
results.creator_credit: Robert Anderson and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Disordered Mind”.
Psychiatrist Dr. Taylor discusses Tommy, a six year old boy who is afraid of attending school. Interviews with Tommy and his parents eventually reveal the cause and help Tommy overcome his fear.

results.title: Afraid of school: a case of school phobia (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Robert Anderson and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Disordered Mind”.
Tommy, aged six, refuses to go to school and is obsessed with thoughts of death and dying. After bribery, persuasion and spanking, his desperate parents seek psychiatric help at a children’s hospital. Both Tommy and his parents receive counselling, and learn to come to grips with his going to school. Psychiatrist: Taylor Statten, MD.
